title: Classic Movie Quotes
description: Match these iconic movie quotes to the films they came from!

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'Here's looking at you, kid'?
questions.explanation: Humphrey Bogart says this iconic line to Ingrid Bergman in the 1942 classic Casablanca.

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'I'm gonna make him an offer he can't refuse'?
questions.explanation: Marlon Brando as Don Vito Corleone delivers this famous line in The Godfather (1972).

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'You can't handle the truth!'?
questions.explanation: Jack Nicholson shouts this line during the courtroom scene in A Few Good Men (1992).

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'May the Force be with you'?
questions.explanation: This iconic phrase is used throughout the Star Wars franchise, first appearing in 1977.

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn'?
questions.explanation: Clark Gable as Rhett Butler says this to Scarlett O'Hara in Gone with the Wind (1939).

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'I'll be back'?
questions.explanation: Arnold Schwarzenegger delivers this famous line in The Terminator (1984).

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'There's no place like home'?
questions.explanation: Judy Garland as Dorothy clicks her ruby slippers and says this in The Wizard of Oz (1939).

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'You talkin' to me?'?
questions.explanation: Robert De Niro improvised this famous line while looking in a mirror in Taxi Driver (1976).

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'E.T. phone home'?
questions.explanation: The lovable alien speaks this line in Steven Spielberg's E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial (1982).

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'Bond. James Bond.'?
questions.explanation: Sean Connery first introduced himself this way in Dr. No (1962), the first James Bond film.

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'Life is like a box of chocolates'?
questions.explanation: Tom Hanks as Forrest Gump shares his mama's wisdom in Forrest Gump (1994).

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'I see dead people'?
questions.explanation: Haley Joel Osment whispers this chilling line in The Sixth Sense (1999).

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'After all, tomorrow is another day'?
questions.explanation: Vivien Leigh as Scarlett O'Hara ends Gone with the Wind (1939) with this hopeful line.

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'Here's Johnny!'?
questions.explanation: Jack Nicholson ad-libbed this line while breaking through a door with an axe in The Shining (1980).

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'Nobody puts Baby in a corner'?
questions.explanation: Patrick Swayze says this line in the climax of Dirty Dancing (1987).

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'We're not in Kansas anymore'?
questions.explanation: Dorothy says 'Toto, I've a feeling we're not in Kansas anymore' in The Wizard of Oz (1939).

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'I coulda been a contender'?
questions.explanation: Marlon Brando delivers this heartbreaking line in On the Waterfront (1954).

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'Elementary, my dear Watson'?
questions.explanation: While never said exactly this way in the original books, the phrase appears in the 1929 film The Return of Sherlock Holmes and the 1939 The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes.

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'Rosebud...'?
questions.explanation: The dying word of Charles Foster Kane in Citizen Kane (1941) — one of cinema's greatest mysteries.

questions.question: Which movie features the quote: 'Houston, we have a problem'?
questions.explanation: Tom Hanks as astronaut Jim Lovell delivers this famous line in Apollo 13 (1995).
